entry.title: 3/25 - Eat Me, Drink Me - An Exhibition of Curious Things
entry.content:
Long Island City Artists / The Plaxall Gallery
üìç LIC, NY, United States
üé® All Visual Arts
üìÖ 03/25/2019 deadline
üí∞ $40.00 fee
‚û° Apply


====== DESCRIPTION ======

Open Call for Art: "Drink Me, Taste Me - An Exhibition of Curious Things

Curated by Norma Homberg
A fine art exhibition where the artwork will also serve as the stage for the full-length musical production of ‚ÄúPainted Alice‚Äù, a satirical adaptation of Lewis Caroll‚Äôs ‚ÄúAlice In Wonderland‚Äù that takes place in an art gallery. Alice, a painter who has lost all inspiration after getting her first commission, distances herself from her partner and falls through her blank canvas into a visual art inspired wonderland where she is forced to answer the question: ‚ÄúDoes domestic bliss equal artistic death?‚Äù

This exhibition is looking for artwork based on the traditional novel of Alice falling into a rabbit hole with peculiar anthropomorphic creatures as well as for the production of ‚ÄúPainted Alice‚Äù where Life, Art and many curious things collide.

There will also be a sensory portion to this exhibition and the curator is looking for work that speaks to the senses of touch, smell & taste.

All mediums welcome. Themes include:

Lewis Carroll‚Äôs Alice in Wonderland
Tortured Artists
Mermaids
Sea Of Tears
Falling... (down the rabbit hole)
Modern Renaissance
Mad Tea Party
Rejected Commissioned Work
Domestic Bliss/Artistic Death

Submission Deadline: March 25, 11:59pm
Submission fee: $20.00 for LIC-A members, $40.00 for non-members

Exhibition on View: April 11 ‚Äì May 12
Opening Reception: April 13, 7-10pm


===== INSTRUCTIONS =====

http://licartists.formstack.com

This exhibition is looking for artwork based on the traditional novel of Alice falling into a rabbit hole with peculiar anthropomorphic creatures as well as for the production of ‚ÄúPainted Alice‚Äù where Life, Art and many curious things collide.

There will also be a sensory portion to this exhibition and the curator is looking for work that speaks to the senses of touch, smell & taste.

All mediums welcome. Themes include:

Lewis Carroll‚Äôs Alice in Wonderland
Tortured Artists
Mermaids
Sea Of Tears
Falling... (down the rabbit hole)
Modern Renaissance
Mad Tea Party
Rejected Commissioned Work
Domestic Bliss/Artistic Death

Submission Deadline: March 25, 11:59pm

Submission fee: $20.00 for LIC-A members, $40.00 for non-members

Exhibition on View: April 11 ‚Äì May 12
Opening Reception: April 13, 7-10pm

entry.title: 5/10 - PAPERWORKS 2019 National Fine Arts Competition
entry.content:
b.j. spoke gallery
üìç Huntington, NY, United States
üé® All Visual Arts
üìÖ 05/10/2019 deadline
üí∞ $35.00 fee
‚û° Apply


====== DESCRIPTION ======

JUROR: Hillary Reder, Curatorial Assistant, Department of Prints & Drawings, Museum of Modern Art, NY.

AWARD: Exhibition of up to six selected works, August 2019 at the b.j.spoke gallery. Promotion of winning artists on b.j. spoke gallery website and social media.

ELIGIBILITY: Open to Artists living in the United States who use paper as their primary medium, as a substrate, or as the subject of a video.

MEDIA: Works made of, on or about paper: cut paper, folded paper, woven paper, glued paper, drawings, paintings, pastels, prints, photographs, paper sculpture, 3D, bound books, collage, mixed media, video, and installation.


===== INSTRUCTIONS =====

For prospectus and how to submit your work, go to http://www.bjspokegallery.org
